conclusion: Determine the minimum force at point D to keep the CD rope level using vector analysis and equilibrium conditions.
The weight of mass m is suspended on point C exerting a vertical force mg.
Ropes AC and BC are symmetric and form an angle θ with the horizontal.
Rope CD is horizontal and must be in equilibrium.
The sum of forces in vertical and horizontal directions must be zero for equilibrium.
Vertical component of tension must balance weight mg.
Let tension in each rope be T.
Vertical component of tension in each rope is T sin θ.
Horizontal component of tension in each rope is T cos θ.
Vertical components of tensions balance weight mg: 2T sin θ = mg.
Solve for T: T = mg / (2 sin θ).
Horizontal components of tensions must equal and opposite: 2T cos θ = F_D.
Substitute T = mg / (2 sin θ) into equation: F_D = mg cos θ / sin θ = mg cot θ.
Minimum value of cot θ occurs when system is in most stable configuration.
Minimum non-zero value of cot θ determined by geometry of system.
